title: SpaceBeat: Identity-aware Multi-person Vital Signs Monitoring Using Commodity WiFi
venue: Proc. ACM Interact. Mob. Wearable Ubiquitous Technol.
relevance_to_wifi_har: Very High - Identity-aware multi-person vital signs monitoring
technical_approach: Spatial domain separation with 2D AoA estimation and cPCA-CL framework
key_contributions: First identity-aware multi-person WiFi vital signs monitoring system
Novel cPCA-CL framework for signal decoupling
2D angle-of-arrival estimation with L-shaped antenna arrays
Comprehensive multidimensional signal processing (ToF, AoD integration)
Sophisticated harmonic cancellation for heartbeat extraction

cross_domain_applicability.domain_adaptation: High - Spatial domain processing enables cross-environment operation
cross_domain_applicability.scalability: Good - Supports up to 3 people with graceful performance degradation
cross_domain_applicability.environmental_robustness: Excellent - Maintains >98% accuracy across diverse conditions
cross_domain_applicability.interference_tolerance: High - Robust against walking, jumping, hand-waving interferences

stability_analysis.environmental_variation: Strong - Only 0.46%/0.44% accuracy reduction in complex scenes

practical_deployment.hardware_requirements: Commodity WiFi with Intel 5300 NICs in L-shaped configuration
practical_deployment.computational_complexity: High - 4D MUSIC algorithm requires server-grade processing
practical_deployment.real_time_capability: Limited - Current computational requirements prevent real-time deployment

cross_domain_insights: Spatial domain processing significantly outperforms signal domain approaches for multi-person scenarios
Identity-aware monitoring enables person-specific vital signs tracking without retraining
2D AoA estimation with multidimensional information fusion improves resolvability
Iterative signal decoupling through cPCA-CL framework achieves superior interference rejection
L-shaped antenna configurations provide sufficient spatial resolution for practical deployment
